job_title: Registered Nurse in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Overall, the  staff is amazing and management
cons: Pay is below average. Not enough staff

job_title: Charge Nurse in Kennedy Mills, NJ
pros: Often other nurses were not helpful
cons: Managers and Administrators did not do their Jo

job_title: Manager in New York, NY
pros: The colleagues are very welcoming

job_title: APNP in Philadelphia, PA
pros: hours are good for family
cons: salary is not competitive comparatively

job_title: in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Good tuition reimbursement rates, good health benefits (except vision)
cons: Incompetent management, lack of support from supervisors, lack of recognition for quality patient care, management making promises and not following through, lack of vision benefits, pay not competitive, redundant paperwork, lack of concern for staff well being.

review_title: It's not a terrible place to work - I've worked in better and worse places
job_title: Registered Nurse in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Kennedy has great benefits including a substantial tuition reimbursement plan.  The healthcare plan is pretty limited though and to get the full benefit you have to go to a Kennedy doctor and hospital.
cons: Like I said in the pros, the healthcare plan could be better and allow employees to choose where they want to receive their healthcare vs using a Kennedy hospital.

job_title: Staff RN in Voorhees, NJ
pros: good people, management is very responsive to employees, excellent benefits and competitive pay! management also encourages and supports professional growth among staff
cons: there are no cons! the hospital might not look as spiffy as the other ones out there, but the money they save from not doing unnecessary cosmetic work goes into our excellent benefits!

job_title: Mental Health in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: They have some really great people working there.
cons: Some horrific staff there-rude, verbally abusive, disrespectful towards other staff & patients. No raises. No support for staff. Favoritism. Filthy, out dated environment. Terrible treatment programs.

review_title: Best nursing position in my experience
job_title: BSN, RN in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Great patient staff ratio, caring environment, coworkers work together, great pay and benefits.
cons: No place is perfect, my unit is so large and busy that they can't retain Nurse Managers or Assistant Nurse Mangers.  Upper management has unrealistic expectations and so they leave. The front line staff is coherent and effective despite these problems.

job_title: CNA in Stratford, NJ
pros: Nice staff, always offering training classes to expand career skills, clean environment, pays well, great hours, always work, many different work locations
cons: Understaffed frequently, terrible reviews from patients, food is horrible, haven't seen a raise in 5 years, overworked, not enough diversity in staffing

review_title: AWESOME TEAM to be a part of
job_title: CNA/Tech in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: I worked on the Critical Care units, ICU,CCU and step down. The team was a great asset to the company, professional attitude and cared for the patients greatly.
cons: as a new person, never worked in a Critical care setting I didn't feel 3 days orientation was enough but I finally got the hand of it.

job_title: Management in Township of Washington, NJ
pros: Nice day to day employees
cons: Poor management support. Excessive leadership team meetings, Favoritism of the highest Senior leadership for poor VP's who are not in the right position. I have 30+ years as a strong leader and was derailed by politics.

job_title: Patient Care and Also Clerical in Stratford, NJ
pros: Medical benefits and nothing else
cons: Absolutely terrible management. It seems to be a pattern with Kennedy. Every single department is managed by incompetent dredges. I'm talking from the kitchen all the way to hr. Patient care is also terrible! If you want to work for a GOOD hospital there are three others in the area that will reward you for being a great employee with reviews and better pay! Stay away from employment and health care. They're called killer k for a very REAL reason

review_title: What a great place to work!
job_title: Nurse in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Organized and fair - I always felt prepared to do my job well and my nurse manager was always available if we needed her.
cons: It took a long time from when I applied to when I actually started but was well worth the wait

review_title: CEO is good, Rest of Management is terrible
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: Part Time benefits, vacation time buy-back, free parking.
cons: HR is horrible for the entry level employee. Clear divide of job classes.

job_title: Maternal Monitoring/Ultra Sound in Washington Townships, NJ
pros: None look somewhere else for a job
cons: Watch your back.I started working at Kennedy Washington Twp just over 2 years ago. Its sucks when your the only one in your department that knows how to do a proper sonogram. I worked in a hospital in Philadelphia that would not have hired these supposed Ultra Sound Technicians to empty bed pans. Philadelphia hospitals have such higher standards. I should have stayed here.

job_title: Lab Support Specialist in Cherry Hill, NJ
pros: People are nice, job is not hard but is stressful at times.
cons: Mgmt is unpredictable. Different rules for different people@ different times on dail basis. Mgmt doesn't lead by example.

job_title: Vice President in Voorhees, NJ
pros: Great People to work with, new Sr. Leadership who are committed to a great employee experience and good locations
cons: Facilities are challenged in terms of age and capacity. Cannot really think of anything else that I would consider a significant Con

review_title: Management is terrible, not neutral or fair with everyone.

cons: Call outs. Lazy coworkers. Not enough uniforms. Manager flip flops.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Washington Townships, NJ

job_title: MSN RN in Cherry Hill, NJ

cons: There is no room for growth or promotion. The ability to grow in this organization is virtually impossible.  Double standards are at the core of this organization.

job_title: Staff RN in Sewell, NJ
pros: Mostly work in pediatric ER where I have the most experience. Recently acquired CPEN
cons: To much movement of patients, decreasing patient satisfaction.

review_title: Decent place to work. Pay is lower than average based on other facilities
